name: polyglot-analyzer
description: Rust language support for Visual Studio Code

untrustedWorkspaces.description: rust-analyzer invokes binaries set up by its configuration as well as the Rust toolchain's binaries. A malicious actor could exploit this to run arbitrary code on your machine.

commands.title: View File Text (as seen by the server)
Rebuild proc macros and build scripts
Add current file's crate to workspace

polyglot-analyzer.runnables.extraEnv.markdownDescription: Environment variables passed to the runnable launched using `Test` or `Debug` lens or `polyglot-analyzer.run` command.

polyglot-analyzer.runnables.problemMatch.markdownDescription: Problem matchers to use for `polyglot-analyzer.run` command, eg `["$rustc", "$rust-panic"]`.

polyglot-analyzer.server.path.markdownDescription: Path to polyglot-analyzer executable (points to bundled binary by default).

polyglot-analyzer.server.extraEnv.markdownDescription: Extra environment variables that will be passed to the polyglot-analyzer executable. Useful for passing e.g. `RA_LOG` for debugging.

enumDescriptions: No traces
Error only
Full log
polyglot-analyzer.trace.server.description: Trace requests to the polyglot-analyzer (this is usually overly verbose and not recommended for regular users).

polyglot-analyzer.trace.extension.description: Enable logging of VS Code extensions itself.

markdownEnumDescriptions: First try to use [CodeLLDB](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vadimcn.vscode-lldb), if it's not installed try to use [MS C++ tools](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.cpptools).

polyglot-analyzer.debug.sourceFileMap.description: Optional source file mappings passed to the debug engine.

polyglot-analyzer.debug.openDebugPane.markdownDescription: Whether to open up the `Debug Panel` on debugging start.

polyglot-analyzer.debug.engineSettings.markdownDescription: Optional settings passed to the debug engine. Example: `{ "lldb": { "terminal":"external"} }`

polyglot-analyzer.restartServerOnConfigC.markdownDescription: Whether to restart the server automatically when certain settings that require a restart are changed.

polyglot-analyzer.typing.continueComment.markdownDescription: Whether to prefix newlines after comments with the corresponding comment prefix.

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.previewRus.markdownDescription: Whether to show the main part of the rendered rustc output of a diagnostic message.

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.useRustcEr.markdownDescription: Whether to use the rustc error code.

polyglot-analyzer.discoverProjectCommand.markdownDescription:
Sets the command that polyglot-analyzer uses to generate `rust-project.json` files. This command should only be used
 if a build system like Buck or Bazel is also in use. The command must accept files as arguments and return 
 a rust-project.json over stdout.

polyglot-analyzer.showUnlinkedFileNotifi.markdownDescription: Whether to show a notification for unlinked files asking the user to add the corresponding Cargo.toml to the linked projects setting.

polyglot-analyzer.showDependenciesExplor.markdownDescription: Whether to show the dependencies view.

polyglot-analyzer.assist.emitMustUse.markdownDescription:
Whether to insert #[must_use] when generating `as_` methods
for enum variants.

polyglot-analyzer.assist.expressionFillD.markdownDescription: Placeholder expression to use for missing expressions in assists.
enumDescriptions: Fill missing expressions with the `todo` macro
Fill missing expressions with reasonable defaults, `new` or `default` constructors.

polyglot-analyzer.cachePriming.enable.markdownDescription: Warm up caches on project load.

polyglot-analyzer.cachePriming.numThread.markdownDescription: How many worker threads to handle priming caches. The default `0` means to pick automatically.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.autoreload.markdownDescription:
Automatically refresh project info via `cargo metadata` on
`Cargo.toml` or `.cargo/config.toml` changes.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.ena.markdownDescription: Run build scripts (`build.rs`) for more precise code analysis.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.inv.markdownDescription:
Specifies the working directory for running build scripts.
- "workspace": run build scripts for a workspace in the workspace's root directory.
    This is incompatible with `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.invocationStrategy#` set to `once`.
- "root": run build scripts in the project's root directory.
This config only has an effect when `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.overrideCommand#`
is set.
enumDescriptions: The command will be executed in the corresponding workspace root.
The command will be executed in the project root.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.inv.markdownDescription:
Specifies the invocation strategy to use when running the build scripts command.
If `per_workspace` is set, the command will be executed for each workspace.
If `once` is set, the command will be executed once.
This config only has an effect when `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.overrideCommand#`
is set.
enumDescriptions: The command will be executed for each workspace.
The command will be executed once.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.ove.markdownDescription:
Override the command polyglot-analyzer uses to run build scripts and
build procedural macros. The command is required to output json
and should therefore include `--message-format=json` or a similar
option.

By default, a cargo invocation will be constructed for the configured
targets and features, with the following base command line:

```bash
cargo check --quiet --workspace --message-format=json --all-targets
```
.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.use.markdownDescription:
Use `RUSTC_WRAPPER=polyglot-analyzer` when running build scripts to
avoid checking unnecessary things.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.cfgs.markdownDescription: List of cfg options to enable with the given values.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.extraArgs.markdownDescription: Extra arguments that are passed to every cargo invocation.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.extraEnv.markdownDescription:
Extra environment variables that will be set when running cargo, rustc
or other commands within the workspace. Useful for setting RUSTFLAGS.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.features.markdownDescription:
List of features to activate.

Set this to `"all"` to pass `--all-features` to cargo.

enumDescriptions: Pass `--all-features` to cargo

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.sysroot.markdownDescription:
Relative path to the sysroot, or "discover" to try to automatically find it via
"rustc --print sysroot".

Unsetting this disables sysroot loading.

This option does not take effect until polyglot-analyzer is restarted.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.sysrootSrc.markdownDescription:
Relative path to the sysroot library sources. If left unset, this will default to
`{cargo.sysroot}/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library`.

This option does not take effect until polyglot-analyzer is restarted.

polyglot-analyzer.cargo.unsetTest.markdownDescription: Unsets the implicit `#[cfg(test)]` for the specified crates.

polyglot-analyzer.checkOnSave.markdownDescription: Run the check command for diagnostics on save.

polyglot-analyzer.check.command.markdownDescription: Cargo command to use for `cargo check`.

polyglot-analyzer.check.extraEnv.markdownDescription:
Extra environment variables that will be set when running `cargo check`.
Extends `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.extraEnv#`.

polyglot-analyzer.check.features.markdownDescription:
List of features to activate. Defaults to
`#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.features#`.

Set to `"all"` to pass `--all-features` to Cargo.

enumDescriptions: Pass `--all-features` to cargo

polyglot-analyzer.check.invocationLocati.markdownDescription:
Specifies the working directory for running checks.
- "workspace": run checks for workspaces in the corresponding workspaces' root directories.
    This falls back to "root" if `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.checkOnSave.invocationStrategy#` is set to `once`.
- "root": run checks in the project's root directory.
This config only has an effect when `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.overrideCommand#`
is set.
enumDescriptions: The command will be executed in the corresponding workspace root.
The command will be executed in the project root.

polyglot-analyzer.check.invocationStrate.markdownDescription:
Specifies the invocation strategy to use when running the checkOnSave command.
If `per_workspace` is set, the command will be executed for each workspace.
If `once` is set, the command will be executed once.
This config only has an effect when `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.overrideCommand#`
is set.
enumDescriptions: The command will be executed for each workspace.
The command will be executed once.

polyglot-analyzer.check.noDefaultFeature.markdownDescription:
Whether to pass `--no-default-features` to Cargo. Defaults to
`#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.noDefaultFeatures#`.

polyglot-analyzer.check.overrideCommand.markdownDescription:
Override the command polyglot-analyzer uses instead of `cargo check` for
diagnostics on save. The command is required to output json and
should therefore include `--message-format=json` or a similar option
(if your client supports the `colorDiagnosticOutput` experimental
capability, you can use `--message-format=json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi`).

If you're changing this because you're using some tool wrapping
Cargo, you might also want to change
`#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.overrideCommand#`.

If there are multiple linked projects, this command is invoked for
each of them, with the working directory being the project root
(i.e., the folder containing the `Cargo.toml`).

An example command would be:

```bash
cargo check --workspace --message-format=json --all-targets
```
.

polyglot-analyzer.check.targets.markdownDescription:
Check for specific targets. Defaults to `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.target#` if empty.

Can be a single target, e.g. `"x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu"` or a list of targets, e.g.
`["aarch64-apple-darwin", "x86_64-apple-darwin"]`.

Aliased as `"checkOnSave.targets"`.

polyglot-analyzer.completion.autoimport..markdownDescription:
Toggles the additional completions that automatically add imports when completed.
Note that your client must specify the `additionalTextEdits` LSP client capability to truly have this feature enabled.

polyglot-analyzer.completion.autoself.en.markdownDescription:
Toggles the additional completions that automatically show method calls and field accesses
with `self` prefixed to them when inside a method.

polyglot-analyzer.completion.callable.sn.markdownDescription: Whether to add parenthesis and argument snippets when completing function.
enumDescriptions: Add call parentheses and pre-fill arguments.
Add call parentheses.
Do no snippet completions for callables.

polyglot-analyzer.completion.limit.markdownDescription: Maximum number of completions to return. If `None`, the limit is infinite.

polyglot-analyzer.completion.postfix.ena.markdownDescription: Whether to show postfix snippets like `dbg`, `if`, `not`, etc.

polyglot-analyzer.completion.privateEdit.markdownDescription: Enables completions of private items and fields that are defined in the current workspace even if they are not visible at the current position.

Box::pin.description: Put the expression into a pinned `Box`

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.disabled.markdownDescription: List of polyglot-analyzer diagnostics to disable.

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.enable.markdownDescription: Whether to show native polyglot-analyzer diagnostics.

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.experiment.markdownDescription:
Whether to show experimental polyglot-analyzer diagnostics that might
have more false positives than usual.

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.remapPrefi.markdownDescription:
Map of prefixes to be substituted when parsing diagnostic file paths.
This should be the reverse mapping of what is passed to `rustc` as `--remap-path-prefix`.

polyglot-analyzer.diagnostics.warningsAs.markdownDescription:
List of warnings that should be displayed with hint severity.

The warnings will be indicated by faded text or three dots in code
and will not show up in the `Problems Panel`.

List of warnings that should be displayed with info severity.

The warnings will be indicated by a blue squiggly underline in code
and a blue icon in the `Problems Panel`.

polyglot-analyzer.files.excludeDirs.markdownDescription:
These directories will be ignored by polyglot-analyzer. They are
relative to the workspace root, and globs are not supported. You may
also need to add the folders to Code's `files.watcherExclude`.

enumDescriptions: Use the client (editor) to watch files for changes
Use server-side file watching

polyglot-analyzer.highlightRelated.break.markdownDescription: Enables highlighting of related references while the cursor is on `break`, `loop`, `while`, or `for` keywords.

polyglot-analyzer.highlightRelated.closu.markdownDescription: Enables highlighting of all captures of a closure while the cursor is on the `|` or move keyword of a closure.

polyglot-analyzer.highlightRelated.exitP.markdownDescription: Enables highlighting of all exit points while the cursor is on any `return`, `?`, `fn`, or return type arrow (`->`).

polyglot-analyzer.highlightRelated.refer.markdownDescription: Enables highlighting of related references while the cursor is on any identifier.

polyglot-analyzer.highlightRelated.yield.markdownDescription: Enables highlighting of all break points for a loop or block context while the cursor is on any `async` or `await` keywords.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.debug.en.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Debug` action. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.enable.markdownDescription: Whether to show HoverActions in Rust files.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.gotoType.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Go to Type Definition` action. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.implemen.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Implementations` action. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.referenc.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `References` action. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.run.enab.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Run` action. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.hover.actions.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.documentation.en.markdownDescription: Whether to show documentation on hover.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.documentation.ke.markdownDescription:
Whether to show keyword hover popups. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.hover.documentation.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.links.enable.markdownDescription: Use markdown syntax for links on hover.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.memoryLayout.ali.markdownDescription: How to render the align information in a memory layout hover.

enumDescriptions: Render as 12 (0xC)
Render as 12
Render as 0xC

polyglot-analyzer.hover.memoryLayout.ena.markdownDescription: Whether to show memory layout data on hover.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.memoryLayout.nic.markdownDescription: How to render the niche information in a memory layout hover.

polyglot-analyzer.hover.memoryLayout.off.markdownDescription: How to render the offset information in a memory layout hover.

enumDescriptions: Render as 12 (0xC)
Render as 12
Render as 0xC

polyglot-analyzer.hover.memoryLayout.siz.markdownDescription: How to render the size information in a memory layout hover.

enumDescriptions: Render as 12 (0xC)
Render as 12
Render as 0xC

polyglot-analyzer.imports.granularity.en.markdownDescription: Whether to enforce the import granularity setting for all files. If set to false polyglot-analyzer will try to keep import styles consistent per file.

polyglot-analyzer.imports.granularity.gr.markdownDescription: How imports should be grouped into use statements.
enumDescriptions: Do not change the granularity of any imports and preserve the original structure written by the developer.
Merge imports from the same crate into a single use statement. Conversely, imports from different crates are split into separate statements.
Merge imports from the same module into a single use statement. Conversely, imports from different modules are split into separate statements.
Flatten imports so that each has its own use statement.

polyglot-analyzer.imports.group.enable.markdownDescription: Group inserted imports by the [following order](https://polyglot-analyzer.github.io/manual.html#auto-import). Groups are separated by newlines.

polyglot-analyzer.imports.merge.glob.markdownDescription: Whether to allow import insertion to merge new imports into single path glob imports like `use std::fmt::*;`.

polyglot-analyzer.imports.prefer.no.std.markdownDescription: Prefer to unconditionally use imports of the core and alloc crate, over the std crate.

polyglot-analyzer.imports.prefix.markdownDescription: The path structure for newly inserted paths to use.
enumDescriptions: Insert import paths relative to the current module, using up to one `super` prefix if the parent module contains the requested item.
Insert import paths relative to the current module, using up to one `super` prefix if the parent module contains the requested item. Prefixes `self` in front of the path if it starts with a module.
Force import paths to be absolute by always starting them with `crate` or the extern crate name they come from.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.bindingMode.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay type hints for binding modes.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.chainingHin.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay type hints for method chains.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.closingBrac.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay hints after a closing `}` to indicate what item it belongs to.

Minimum number of lines required before the `}` until the hint is shown (set to 0 or 1
to always show them).

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.closureCapt.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay hints for closure captures.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.closureRetu.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay type hints for return types of closures.
enumDescriptions: Always show type hints for return types of closures.
Never show type hints for return types of closures.
Only show type hints for return types of closures with blocks.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.closureStyl.markdownDescription: Closure notation in type and chaining inlay hints.
enumDescriptions: `impl_fn`: `impl FnMut(i32, u64) -> i8`
`rust_analyzer`: `|i32, u64| -> i8`
`with_id`: `{closure#14352}`, where that id is the unique number of the closure in r-a internals
`hide`: Shows `...` for every closure type

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.discriminan.markdownDescription: Whether to show enum variant discriminant hints.
enumDescriptions: Always show all discriminant hints.
Never show discriminant hints.
Only show discriminant hints on fieldless enum variants.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.expressionA.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay hints for type adjustments.
enumDescriptions: Always show all adjustment hints.
Never show adjustment hints.
Only show auto borrow and dereference adjustment hints.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.expressionA.markdownDescription: Whether to hide inlay hints for type adjustments outside of `unsafe` blocks.
Whether to show inlay hints as postfix ops (`.*` instead of `*`, etc).
enumDescriptions: Always show adjustment hints as prefix (`*expr`).
Always show adjustment hints as postfix (`expr.*`).
Show prefix or postfix depending on which uses less parenthesis, preferring prefix.
Show prefix or postfix depending on which uses less parenthesis, preferring postfix.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.lifetimeEli.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay type hints for elided lifetimes in function signatures.
enumDescriptions: Always show lifetime elision hints.
Never show lifetime elision hints.
Only show lifetime elision hints if a return type is involved.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.lifetimeEli.markdownDescription: Whether to prefer using parameter names as the name for elided lifetime hints if possible.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.maxLength.markdownDescription: Maximum length for inlay hints. Set to null to have an unlimited length.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.parameterHi.markdownDescription:
Whether to show function parameter name inlay hints at the call
site.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.reborrowHin.markdownDescription:
Whether to show inlay hints for compiler inserted reborrows.
This setting is deprecated in favor of #polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.expressionAdjustmentHints.enable#.
enumDescriptions: Always show reborrow hints.
Never show reborrow hints.
Only show mutable reborrow hints.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.renderColon.markdownDescription: Whether to render leading colons for type hints, and trailing colons for parameter hints.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.typeHints.e.markdownDescription: Whether to show inlay type hints for variables.

polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.typeHints.h.markdownDescription:
Whether to hide inlay type hints for `let` statements that initialize to a closure.
Only applies to closures with blocks, same as `#polyglot-analyzer.inlayHints.closureReturnTypeHints.enable#`.
Whether to hide inlay type hints for constructors.

polyglot-analyzer.interpret.tests.markdownDescription: Enables the experimental support for interpreting tests.

polyglot-analyzer.joinLines.joinAssignme.markdownDescription: Join lines merges consecutive declaration and initialization of an assignment.

polyglot-analyzer.joinLines.joinElseIf.markdownDescription: Join lines inserts else between consecutive ifs.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.debug.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Debug` lens. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable.markdownDescription: Whether to show CodeLens in Rust files.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.forceCustomComman.markdownDescription:
Internal config: use custom client-side commands even when the
client doesn't set the corresponding capability.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.implementations.e.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Implementations` lens. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

enumDescriptions: Render annotations above the name of the item.
Render annotations above the whole item, including documentation comments and attributes.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.references.adt.en.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `References` lens for Struct, Enum, and Union.
Only applies when `#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.references.enumVa.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `References` lens for Enum Variants.
Only applies when `#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.references.method.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Method References` lens. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.references.trait..markdownDescription:
Whether to show `References` lens for Trait.
Only applies when `#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.lens.run.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show `Run` lens. Only applies when
`#polyglot-analyzer.lens.enable#` is set.

polyglot-analyzer.linkedProjects.markdownDescription:
Disable project auto-discovery in favor of explicitly specified set
of projects.

Elements must be paths pointing to `Cargo.toml`,
`rust-project.json`, or JSON objects in `rust-project.json` format.

polyglot-analyzer.lru.capacity.markdownDescription: Number of syntax trees polyglot-analyzer keeps in memory. Defaults to 128.

polyglot-analyzer.lru.query.capacities.markdownDescription: Sets the LRU capacity of the specified queries.

polyglot-analyzer.notifications.cargoTom.markdownDescription: Whether to show `can't find Cargo.toml` error message.

polyglot-analyzer.numThreads.markdownDescription: How many worker threads in the main loop. The default `null` means to pick automatically.

polyglot-analyzer.procMacro.attributes.e.markdownDescription: Expand attribute macros. Requires `#polyglot-analyzer.procMacro.enable#` to be set.

polyglot-analyzer.procMacro.enable.markdownDescription: Enable support for procedural macros, implies `#polyglot-analyzer.cargo.buildScripts.enable#`.

polyglot-analyzer.procMacro.ignored.markdownDescription:
These proc-macros will be ignored when trying to expand them.

This config takes a map of crate names with the exported proc-macro names to ignore as values.

polyglot-analyzer.procMacro.server.markdownDescription: Internal config, path to proc-macro server executable.

polyglot-analyzer.runnables.command.markdownDescription: Command to be executed instead of 'cargo' for runnables.

polyglot-analyzer.runnables.extraArgs.markdownDescription:
Additional arguments to be passed to cargo for runnables such as
tests or binaries. For example, it may be `--release`.

polyglot-analyzer.rustc.source.markdownDescription:
Path to the Cargo.toml of the rust compiler workspace, for usage in rustc_private
projects, or "discover" to try to automatically find it if the `rustc-dev` component
is installed.

Any project which uses polyglot-analyzer with the rustcPrivate
crates must set `[package.metadata.polyglot-analyzer] rustc_private=true` to use it.

This option does not take effect until polyglot-analyzer is restarted.

polyglot-analyzer.rustfmt.overrideComman.markdownDescription:
Advanced option, fully override the command polyglot-analyzer uses for
formatting. This should be the equivalent of `rustfmt` here, and
not that of `cargo fmt`. The file contents will be passed on the
standard input and the formatted result will be read from the
standard output.

polyglot-analyzer.rustfmt.rangeFormattin.markdownDescription:
Enables the use of rustfmt's unstable range formatting command for the
`textDocument/rangeFormatting` request. The rustfmt option is unstable and only
available on a nightly build.

polyglot-analyzer.semanticHighlighting.d.markdownDescription:
Inject additional highlighting into doc comments.

When enabled, polyglot-analyzer will highlight rust source in doc comments as well as intra
doc links.

polyglot-analyzer.semanticHighlighting.n.markdownDescription: Whether the server is allowed to emit non-standard tokens and modifiers.

polyglot-analyzer.semanticHighlighting.o.markdownDescription:
Use semantic tokens for operators.

When disabled, polyglot-analyzer will emit semantic tokens only for operator tokens when
they are tagged with modifiers.

Use specialized semantic tokens for operators.

When enabled, polyglot-analyzer will emit special token types for operator tokens instead
of the generic `operator` token type.

polyglot-analyzer.semanticHighlighting.p.markdownDescription:
Use semantic tokens for punctuation.

When disabled, polyglot-analyzer will emit semantic tokens only for punctuation tokens when
they are tagged with modifiers or have a special role.

When enabled, polyglot-analyzer will emit a punctuation semantic token for the `!` of macro
calls.

Use specialized semantic tokens for punctuation.

When enabled, polyglot-analyzer will emit special token types for punctuation tokens instead
of the generic `punctuation` token type.

polyglot-analyzer.semanticHighlighting.s.markdownDescription:
Use semantic tokens for strings.

In some editors (e.g. vscode) semantic tokens override other highlighting grammars.
By disabling semantic tokens for strings, other grammars can be used to highlight
their contents.

polyglot-analyzer.signatureInfo.detail.markdownDescription: Show full signature of the callable. Only shows parameters if disabled.
enumDescriptions: Show the entire signature.
Show only the parameters.

polyglot-analyzer.typing.autoClosingAngl.markdownDescription: Whether to insert closing angle brackets when typing an opening angle bracket of a generic argument list.

enumDescriptions: Search for types only.
Search for all symbols kinds.

polyglot-analyzer.workspace.symbol.searc.markdownDescription:
Limits the number of items returned from a workspace symbol search (Defaults to 128).
Some clients like vs-code issue new searches on result filtering and don't require all results to be returned in the initial search.
Other clients requires all results upfront and might require a higher limit.

enumDescriptions: Search in current workspace only.
Search in current workspace and dependencies.

colors.description: Color of the border displayed in the Rust source code for the selected syntax node (see "Show Syntax Tree" command)

semanticTokenTypes.description: Style for attribute invocation brackets, that is the `#[` and `]` tokens
Style for char escapes in strings
Style for {} placeholders in format strings
Style for the ! token of macro calls
Style for the self type keyword
Style for names which can not be resolved due to compilation errors

semanticTokenModifiers.description: Style for async functions and the `async` and `await` keywords
Style for locals whose types implements one of the `Fn*` traits
Style for locals that are being consumed when use in a function call
Style for control-flow related tokens, this includes the `?` operator
Style for names resolving to a crate root
Style for doc-string injected highlighting like rust source blocks in documentation
Style for intra doc links in doc-strings
Style for items that are defined outside of the current crate
Style for mutable locals and statics as well as functions taking `&mut self`
Style for items that are from the current crate and are `pub`
Style for locals behind a reference and functions taking `self` by reference
Style for unsafe operations, like unsafe function calls, as well as the `unsafe` token
